importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the Secret Service discovered the suspicious hunting stand near Air Force One’s landing zone in Florida, marking a key security incident ahead of President Trump’s arrival.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred during the advance security preparations prior to President Trump’s return to West Palm Beach, placing it within a high-risk period due to recent assassination attempts.

keyTakeAways: The US Secret Service discovered a suspicious hunting stand located within sight of the Air Force One landing zone at Palm Beach International Airport.
No individuals were present at the stand, and there is currently no evidence it was built to target the president.
The stand had been there for some time and was reportedly used by bow hunters, indicating it was not a recent or targeted setup.
The FBI is leading an investigation into the stand’s origin, with forensic tools including digital and biometric analysis being applied to determine who placed it and why.
The discovery comes after two prior assassination attempts on President Donald Trump: one in July 2024 at a Pennsylvania rally and another involving Ryan Routh during a golf outing in Florida.
The Secret Service identified items of interest during physical and technological sweeps, emphasizing layered security protocols.
The hunting stand was dismantled and is currently being transported to a forensic lab for analysis.

namedEntities.name: US Secret Service
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A federal law enforcement agency responsible for protecting the President, Vice President, and other high-profile officials.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Secret Service discovered and reported a suspicious hunting stand near the Air Force One landing zone, highlighting its critical role in pre-arrival security operations.

namedEntities.name: FBI
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The Federal Bureau of Investigation, the primary domestic law enforcement agency of the United States.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The FBI is leading the investigation into the suspicious hunting stand, indicating its role in criminal investigations related to national security threats.

namedEntities.name: Palm Beach International Airport
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major airport in Florida where President Donald Trump is expected to arrive.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The location of the suspicious stand—within sight of the Air Force One landing zone—makes it a high-visibility security site during presidential visits.

namedEntities.name: President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The current President of the United States, central to the security concerns discussed in the article.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The incident occurred ahead of his arrival, raising security concerns due to his recent history of assassination attempts.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Routh
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A man accused and later found guilty of attempting to assassinate President Donald Trump during a golf outing in Florida.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Routh’s prior conviction underscores the heightened security environment, making the discovery of a suspicious stand even more significant.

namedEntities.name: Air Force One landing zone
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The designated area at an airport where the presidential aircraft lands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The hunting stand being found near this zone emphasizes the critical importance of perimeter security and threat detection in presidential access areas.

namedEntities.name: Anthony Guglielmi
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Chief of communications for the US Secret Service.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provided official statements confirming the discovery and the absence of any impact on presidential movements.

namedEntities.name: Dan Bongino
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He confirmed that the stand is being analyzed using forensic tools and that the FBI is investigating its origin and purpose.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The US Secret Service discovered a suspicious hunting stand located within sight of the Air Force One landing zone at Palm Beach International Airport ahead of President Donald Trump’s arrival. No individuals were present, and there is no evidence it was built to target the president. The stand, which had been there for some time and used by bow hunters, was dismantled and is now being analyzed in a forensic lab by the FBI. The FBI is leading the investigation to determine who placed it and why, amid a heightened security context following two prior assassination attempts on Trump—both in 2024. This incident underscores the importance of layered security measures and advanced detection protocols in protecting national leaders.
title: Secret Service finds ‘suspicious’ hunting stand near Air Force One landing zone in Florida
